events.event_name: HCOB Flash Eurozone Composite PMI Release January 2026
events.description: The release of the composite PMI data for the Eurozone, which was revised lower to 51.3.

facts.fact_text: The HCOB Flash Eurozone Composite PMI was 51.3 in January 2026, down from 51.5 in the previous month.

evidences.evidence_text: The HCOB Flash Eurozone Composite PMI inched lower to 51.3 in January of 2026 from the 51.5 in the previous month

facts.fact_text: Manufacturing output rebounded to 50.5 in January from 48.9 in December 2025.
Input cost inflation reached a near one-year high in January.

evidences.evidence_text: input cost inflation rose to a near one-year high

facts.fact_text: Firms reduced employment levels, primarily driven by trends in Germany.

evidences.evidence_text: firms cut back on their employment levels at a marginal pace, mainly due to lower employment in Germany.

claims.claim_text: Business sentiment reached a 20-month high due to increased optimism among manufacturers.
claims.author: HCOB

evidences.evidence_text: business sentiment rose to a 20-month high on greater optimism or manufacturers.

claims.claim_text: New orders growth was restricted by a decline in export orders.

evidences.evidence_text: New orders at the aggregate level rose for a sixth month, although at a sharply lower magnitude with restriction from a fall in export orders.

evidence.evidence_text: input cost inflation rose to a near one-year high, driving output charges to accelerate to its highest since April 2024.
firms cut back on their employment levels at a marginal pace, mainly due to lower employment in Germany.
the result reflected 13 straight months of growth in the Eurozone's private output.
New orders at the aggregate level rose... although at a sharply lower magnitude with restriction from a fall in export orders.
